11 property land assembly in Uptown New Westminster on Seventh Street and Fourth Ave. It is a very central location, in close walking distance to the Royal City Centre, Save On Foods, London Drugs and many cafes, banks and restaurants. The city has recently released it's new OCP. They refer to this area as the Bent Court Study area. They wish to preserve some of the houses that have heritage value while recognizing existing entitlements in this assembly, there are extra lots that can be used to relocate heritage houses. City will consider relaxing parking and commercial requirements and density transfers through heritage revitalization agreement. Pricing is $105 per buildable sq ft.
Realtor Remarks: We have an idea of which houses the city would wish to keep and where they could potentially be relocated.

Public Remarks: One of BC's larger private islands, 175 acre Bull Island is nestled between Lasqueti, Jedediah and Rabbit Island in the Georgia Strait. Bull Island has been used as a family retreat for the last 20+ years, and has basic improvements designed principally for seasonal style use. A good all weather dock provides access to the island. Bull Island is separated from adjacent Jedediah Island by Little Bull Passage. Jedediah Island is a 725 acre marine park, popular with mariners and eco-adventurers. Bull Island has a number of excellent building sites, protected coves and cleared grassy areas making it very accommodating for new development. The zoning would allow up to 8 primary residences, making Bull Island perfect as a group purchase.
Realtor Remarks: NO TOUCHBASE
